Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Michelle S. Mandley
Reviews.Content: Works as directed and easy to install!  Now we know when someone is at our house.  Downside is that even animals can set it off however, a person on foot could set it off too.  Great buy for the cost!

Reviews.Title: crap
Reviews.Author: kay
Reviews.Content: This Product Did Not Work Through Walls At All. Complete waste Of Time And Money. Save YourselF Some The Hassle.

Reviews.Title: Does its job well
Reviews.Author: J. Lord
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised and useful all over the house, including in the basement. We live in a secluded location and it's nice to know when a car comes down the driveway.

Reviews.Title: Not ready for prime time
Reviews.Author: Steven Bush
Reviews.Content: I have a 650 foot driveway.  No obstructions at all. Direct line of site from beginning to end. I bought two of these thinking that I could put one about 200 feet from the house and the other about 80 feet from the house.The only time that I get a signal is if the transmitter is about 40 feet from the house.  Thank goodness I have security cameras in the driveway so that I can see who it is that came up.  I would not  Recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Detection works great but lacks range
Reviews.Author: splanka
Reviews.Content: Got a couple of these to put around my house to warn me of any intruders.  These work great if the receiver has a clear view, but if not they are only good for 20' at the most.  The batteries seem to last for a couple of months, which is fantastic.  Overall these are very dependable if you are within range but would prefer to have something with a better limit through walls.

Reviews.Title: really disappointing
Reviews.Author: taxt
Reviews.Content: Bought two, one worked right off but the other needed a day or so before it kicked in.  A real mystery, but it's working fine now.  A little pricey for a sensor that isn't weatherproof and don't know how long it'll last, but I use the Defender security cameras and have high expectations.  I'll edit my review if they disappoint on down the line.UPDATEJuly 20, 2013 -- Okay, one stopped working all together the first week and the others work sometimes and don't work at all at other times after multiple re-installations looking for a better positioning and changing out the batteries multiple times, etc.  I thought at first it might be the time of day affecting their trigger (lighting), but there's no consistency and I am giving up on them all together and looking for something better. They never did have anything like the range that was claimed for them, either, was lucky to get a 10-foot range.  Pitiful.  I'm marking 2 stars instead of 1 just because they're so pitiful I feel sorry for them.I've used the Defender security camera systems several years and was satisfied with what they offered for the money until the last two I bought and they lack signal/reception strength in a drastic way.  I like sticking with a brand that works, but that no longer includes Defender.

Reviews.Title: Still working great
Reviews.Author: Wayne Bowden
Reviews.Content: Bought it a long while back, built a box to mount it in from a Electrical junction box, then drilled a 2 5/16 hole in it, mounted a 5 inch peice of 2 inch PVC Conduit in it, and sealed it with a bottom of a bottle beer kuzzi.This way I reduced the amount of sideways detection from it so unless something walks into the direct beam that goes out about 30 ft, with a monitored circule of about 1.5ft, it captures all that walks through it. With it off the ground 32in it only catches people, horses, or dogs with their tails up in the air.Amazed how long the batteries have lasted.  The one I have going now is almost 175 ft from the monitor station and it gets a really good signal.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: RZ
Reviews.Content: This is a good product.  After reading reviews I was worried about the volume level, but I guess who ever reviewed it was expecting it to alarm loud through the whole house.  It won't get that high, but it is loud in a single room and you can still hear it quietly in others.  Mine is so loud, I can hear it from outside.  Zero issues.  Perfect product for me.

Reviews.Title: Now he knows when someone is coming
Reviews.Author: Henry O. Milliken Jr
Reviews.Content: This so now he has fair warningwas a gift to our son.He said it was very good.They do not like to be surprised

Reviews.Title: finally took out the batteries
Reviews.Author: Tom D`Agostino
Reviews.Content: poor quality ended up making my dog a pile of nerves it had so many false signals still looking for something better

Reviews.Title: Motion Sensor
Reviews.Author: Justin Steverson
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a motion sensor for inside my house, rather than outside. It works very well. I have it placed in a position that will monitor my stairs coming from the basement and front door while also covering my living room area. I keep the receiver in my bedroom on my headboard shelf, and only turn it on at night. It gives me piece of mind. I may not be able to keep an intruder out of my house indefinitely, but at least I can be alerted that someone has broken in and call the cops, if needed.

Reviews.Title: Unit Broke within a Month
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: Worked great for about a month then stopped working.  Tried contacting the company using their online warranty information request but the system doesn't work. Tried multiple times and the for does not link correctly.  Not worth the money especially if the units break and you can't even contact the company for warranty work.

Reviews.Title: Good unit need more volume on the receiver
Reviews.Author: Dave Nussbaumer
Reviews.Content: Unit works good, has good range. The issue I have is the volume is low, must be in the same room as the receiver to hear it

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it sounds
Reviews.Author: Steve Leach
Reviews.Content: I understand many things can impact the range of transmission but even up close this thing just does not perform as advertised.  Works only occasionally (at best).  Picked up my Kia Optima but missed a Fed Ex truck & a UPS truck.  It picked me up walking down the driveway but missed my friends SUV.Perhaps I just got a bad one but I'm not willing to try again.I am going to try to return mine.

Reviews.Title: Great basic motion sensor - can be used anywhere.
Reviews.Author: Tarun Chachra "Tarun Chachra"
Reviews.Content: The title says its for a driveway..but you can adapt the system to use anywhere that requires motion sensing and an alert.We put this unit outside of our rear entrance near the basement, it is rarely used and good to know when someone is in our out...albeit reminding us that doors need to be locked etc.  The total distance from the basement to upstairs is about 25 linear feet....  We only turn the device on over the weekend as this is the entrance our kids and their friends use to go in and out of our pool.It works great for our purposes and gives us the satisfaction of knowing that one of the kids has ventured to the pool area (safety number 1).  There are some minor gripes with it...like the fact that you need 8 double A batteries to run the system ... they will supposedly last a good chunk of time - but that remains to be seen.  I personally will probably end up using eneloop rechargeable batteries and save some bucks on AA's.  The volume is the other problem...set it too low and you cannot hear a thing..set it too high and your ear drums are in for a ride...its hard to get it just right (but at least you can adjust to your needs).The sensitivity is good for our purposes - where as a kid moving by it very quickly is detected....it also detects our dog moving across it very slowly.Pretty happy with this device....price could be better;;;maybe include the AC adapter for the receiver for free??Overall 4/5 for us.

Reviews.Title: the detector
Reviews.Author: brad Johnson
Reviews.Content: works well and always go off put out on walk way on other side of ac and signal works well may buy 2 more had 5 months worked well then just started going off every ten min. nothing out side changed batt.no help opened anlet it dry out resealed with gasket sealer havent had problem again when it works works well they should seal better

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised, but...
Reviews.Author: Ammy_Evaluator
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is a basic motion sensor coupled with a receiver that beeps when motion is detected. The range and sensitivity of this unit are awesome.Unfortunately, that sensitivity was a problem with our rather short driveway. Even at the lowest sensitivity setting, it kept getting triggered by passing vehicles. The other option was to place it at the bottom of the yard facing inwards. Unfortunately, that not only wastes its range, but also requires a secure covered area at that location - which I didn't have. A covered area is required since this unit is not weather-proof, and it is really easy to un-clip or misuse as a prank.Secondly, the volume of the beeps at the receiver cannot be controlled. Your only choices are piercing or inaudible.Other than that, this is actually a neat device. It is easy to setup (takes only minutes) and install (you mount a bracket and clip the sensor on to it), looks fairly rugged, and can be used with up to three motion sensors.Happy Monitoring!

Reviews.Title: Basic Security When You Need It
Reviews.Author: Nathan M. Rose "Movie Guy from FlickDirect"
Reviews.Content: Love my Defender AL101. We have a really long driveway, so it's nice t be alerted of guests so  that we can be ready to answer the door for them. My boss liked it so much that she bought one for a small business building that she has on her property. It's a great tool to be alerted about "traffic" in areas of your property that aren't highly visible.

Reviews.Title: For basic motion detection, this does the job...
Reviews.Author: Thomas Duff "Duffbert"
Reviews.Content: When I got my Amazon Vine newsletter a couple months back, one of the items I selected was the Defender AL101 Wireless Driveway Alert System.  It's a wireless alarm mechanism that senses motion with the detection unit and triggers an alarm in the receiver.  While billed as a driveway alert device, it's really only limited by your imagination.  If there's somewhere around your house that you need to monitor for movement, this would work reasonably well.  For what I wanted it for, it does what it claims.The motion detector can either be permanently mounted on a surface or clipped into place with the bracket on the back.  The cone-shaped detection range can be adjusted to sense motion at 15 or 30 ft, and runs off of four AA batteries.  It's a little on the heavy side for its size,  so you have to account for that when you decide where to place it.  The alert unit runs off of AC power, and emits a series of beeps (volume is adjustable) when the detector picks up motion.  It's a basic uncomplicated setup and configuration, and it does what it says... detects motion and alerts you.In my case, I work from home and my office is in the basement.  As such, I don't always hear when someone is at the front door.  Given that package delivery services often drop off stuff on our front porch, I like to make sure that I get the package relatively soon so that it doesn't just sit out there.  With this unit, I can set the detector to cover the front porch, and the receiver lets me know when something arrives.  It's a simple solution that works as advertised.Would l change stuff if I could? Sure... a lighter weight would be nice.  Being able to recharge the unit instead of feeding it batteries would be a major plus.  But for simple motion detection and alerts, the Defender does the job.Disclosure:Obtained From: Amazon Vine Review ProgramPayment: Free

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work consistently
Reviews.Author: a reader
Reviews.Content: I put off writing this review because I wanted so much for this driveway alarm to work.  It works sometimes when a car comes up the driveway and then it's wonderful and then it stops working but will go off when a crow flies past but not when a car comes up the driveway.  On the day the farmer came to mow our field, it went off almost continually even though I have it aimed at the driveway and not at the field.  I even hired a handyman to fine tune it thinking I must be doing something wrong but it was still the same - sometimes it works and sometimes not and there's no rhyme or reason to it.  I put it inside a birdhouse to protect it, then took it out, placed it up high, in the middle, down low etc.  It's not hard to set up - quite easy in fact - if only it would work consistently.  Under the circumstances, I can't recommend itUpdate 2013:  I finally got it to work and it works great.  I would change my review to five stars if I could because for the price it's fabulous.  Don't know why it took so long to get it right - finally an electrician gave it one more try and bingo!!

Reviews.Title: Lets us know when someone's on the way to our door.
Reviews.Author: Angela Streiff
Reviews.Content: We set this up in our driveway and have found it useful for several reasons.My husband works night shift (7pm-7am), so he sleeps during the day. Because of this, we have set up our bedroom downstairs in our basement so it's easier to sleep throughout the daylight hours. But as expected, people come to the house during the day (i.e. UPS, USPS, Fed-Ex, friends, neighborer, family, etc). Being downstairs, often he can not hear anyone knock on the door when they show up. Having this unit set up downstairs lets him know when someone has pulled up and is coming up to our porch.Also, his job picks him up for work each evening during shift change (he's in law enforcement and shares a work car with his partner). There is a 15 minute window of time each evening when he can be picked up for work, so he use to stand in the doorway and watch for them to arrive the whole time. Now having this driveway alert system, it lets him know when they are pulling in so he can do other things until it goes off and lets him know they have pulled up.I find the units features work similarly to the same way a motion lights does. The settings can be changed to be more of less sensitive and the volume of the alert is adjustable. We have a lot of animals such as deer and birds always around and tons of pedestrians walking dogs and kids on bikes going by, but we set it up in a location that is typically on trafficked by cars coming in the driveways or someone walking up our driveways to come up our porch. By picking out the location carefully, it keeps everything else from setting off the alarm all day and night. It works great for us.The only thing I would change is having some different alert tones as options. The alert sound this unit makes may not be pleasing to everyone and having maybe 2 or 3 to choose from would be better.

Reviews.Title: Functional
Reviews.Author: ardnam "ardnam"
Reviews.Content: Sender is wireless, which is a positive!  The receiver can use either batteries or an adapter--the adapter comes with the unit. Works well.  Alarm goes off at about a fifteen foot radius.  The one downfall is the tiny little screw that holds the sender in place.  It is so small that when it fell, there was no finding it.  We used this in the back yard rather than the driveway.  It is mounted on our large shed/playhouse.  I was concerned that it would be set of by animals--racoons, squirrels, oppossum, etc. and so far it has not been a problem. You can add sensors without buying another receiver--so three separate area can be covered.

Reviews.Title: Every deer, every rabbit, every dog, every...
Reviews.Author: Simon Cleveland "S. Cleveland"
Reviews.Content: The question is how often would you like to know the number of animals that pass through your property? I know you only care about the dangerous kind - humans - but with this device there is no way to tell. Then again, you won't get a better alarm system for $79.The device comes neatly packaged and makes a good gift for anyone marginally paranoid about safety. Of course, if you have an ADT system, it'll cost you at least $38/month (not counting installation fees), so if you are trying to protect yourself on a budget, this is the device for you (then again, can you put a price on safety)?For what this device is intended to do and for its price - I give it 4 stars. It's extremely subjective to say whether it'll work for your expectations, but for me it's great.Now, if I can only log somewhere the number of times that damn deer passes my driveway...

Reviews.Title: Easy set up, very sensitive
Reviews.Author: Mary Chrapliwy
Reviews.Content: We live in a very rural area with a very long driveway and pretty much no foot traffic in the driveway unless someone is getting into and out of their car - which is precisely why we wanted to try this alert system. This might not be such a plus to people who have kids running and playing out front causing continuous beeping, but then again, you would likely be keeping an eye on kids outside anyway and could shut off the beeper.The beauty of this device is that it was easy to set up and customize to the distance we wanted. Though it goes as far as 30 feet (and our driveway is longer), it did alert us the minute a person pulled into our driveway. Before they even get out of their car, we can look out and see who it is. This is great for those occasions when you have company coming and don't want to have to keep getting up to look out the window for their car. What I liked most about this is knowing when my youngest child pulls into the driveway at night. The shortcoming, but not something I was looking for, was it only senses presence - others who want something more comprehensive might want to invest in an outside camera (which we also have since living in the country left us open to a near robbery in the past - foiled by my dogs).This is overall a very good product that is easy to use. I would caution buyers to carefully read the specs so they know exactly what they're getting and don't expect more than the device delivers.

Reviews.Title: Love this as a stay at home mom...
Reviews.Author: H. Erickson-Sander "Heather"
Reviews.Content: This security device is a lot cheaper than many of the other options out there - such as a full blown security system with a monthly bill. It's an affordable, but very welcome, tool for me to feel safer at home. I live in a nice but urban neighborhood with lots of pedestrian traffic, combined with my fenced but very accessible yard - it's nice to have a device that alerts me when someone has entered my property. So far it's proven to be a very reliable alert system.It's set up was pretty simple. The product comes with a booklet that gives you 800 numbers and further information for those who might need extra help setting up and understanding the sensor and receiver. I, however, found it very simple to start using. The receiver can run on batteries, but also comes with an a/c adapted which is preferred. The sensor uses batteries. Both can be mounted. It worked immediately upon set up, when my husband (or dog) would step outside and into the sensor's range, a loud beep would let me know the sensor "saw" them. This system is customizable, too, which is nice: it can be integrated into most home security systems. Up to three sensors can be used with this, as there are three zones on the receiver.This device is not foolproof, it does not provide maximum security. But that said, for the cost, this alert system still does give me peace of mind knowing that I will be notified immediately when someone is in my yard and approaching my house. Whether it's the UPS man, a neighbor, or someone will ill-intentions - as a stay at home mom with two young children I like to be on guard!

Reviews.Title: for the single family homeowner without little kids and animals
Reviews.Author: carol irvin "carol irvin"
Reviews.Content: I just read Dr. Gitlow's Amazon review here of this product.  I think he basically hits the essential plusses and minuses of this product.  The mistake we made was in thinking we could use this in a Planned Unit Development, which is where we live.  It is way too noisy and hair triggered to work in ANY multifamily situation.  I assume Dr. Gitlow lives in a single family house on a nice size lot without a lot of traffic to his door.  For such a person, letting the homeowner know that someone had been at the door, probably making a delivery, or perhaps making a service call, would be great.  Just change one variable though, like give Dr. Gitlow some little kids who play in the yard frequently, and this would fast make him a menace in his neighborhood with all the claxon sounding noise.  So it is an ok product, which needs refinement, but even then just for the single family homeowner without little kids and animals.

Reviews.Title: Very Basic Alert System!
Reviews.Author: rbhatta "A Dinosaur you can trust!"
Reviews.Content: Defender AL101 wireless driveway system has two parts, one the parent module which is portable and can run on A/C or batteries and the other is the transmitter module/ motion sensor module, they supply with one, but the parent module is a capable of monitoring  additional 2 more with a total of 3 possible motion sensor modules.My Tests indicate that the sensitivity is quite good or over sensitivity even at low setting (that may be because the batteries are brand new :-), Cats and crows! Watch out... I am monitoring you!There are no special bells or whistles to brag about with this product, it is a very basic alert system and I do not think it has the value for the money as currently packaged, if the manufacturer included all three transmitter module rather than 1 module it would have it worthwhile purchase as you can cover front back and side entrances of the house.May be the manufacturer will sell the motion sensor modules at an additional cost or include them free?  In near future packaging... I did not see any additional AL101 motion sensor modules for sale anywhere yet.The alert sound is very basic beep beep beep.  The Blue power LED does not turn off! There is a button to turn off the LED's when it is in monitoring mode but it turns off only the green monitor LEDs the Blue power LED keeps glaring at you at all times!PROS:[+] Simple to setup, No wires no mess, looks well made.[+] Possible Battery operation if A/C were to fail[+] All plastic but good all weather construction[+] Very low power Transmitter module (Battery will last 6 months)[+] It can be hooked up-to home alarm system if needed.CONS:[-] Very Basic Alarm system, Very basic beep alert, Volume control does not do anything much.[-] The parent module will drain 4 AAA batteries in 24hrs[-] If AC power fails, no automatic fail-over to batteries possible! currently as designed.[-] Not all transmitter modules included you need to purchase additional modules.If you are really in need of a quick cheap solution you can try U.S. Patrol Driveway Patrol Infrared Wireless Alert System it is fraction of the cost and does the same job IMHO.

Reviews.Title: Good & Bad Points Alike
Reviews.Author: Dr. Stuart Gitlow
Reviews.Content: The Defender AL101 has two components, a battery powered wireless transmitter and a base unit which plugs into the wall via a wired power brick. Once the two units have been paired, you have a choice between low and high sensitivity. This is chosen on the remote device before the battery cover is applied. You therefore will need to test the unit in the desired location before closing things up and mounting the remote. The instructions were acceptable.The base unit is configured to work with up to three remotes. It remains paired with the chosen remote even when turned off and on again. However, it does not remember which remotes you've chosen to use through a duty cycle. That is, let's say you have two remotes but only want the base unit to alert you for Remote #1. Perhaps Remote #2 will only be used on certain occasions. You set the unit to alert only for Remote #1, turn the unit off, then on again, and now it is alerting you for both remotes - once again you have to set the unit to Remote #1; this isn't a big deal - just something you need to remember to do.The alert itself is a rather harsh beeping sound. Really, in today's digital audio world, a less harshly charactered beep would be nice as an alternative. While there's a volume dial on one side, I found it to be of little help. Either it's doing nothing at all, or the range of control is minimal. I can't tell. There's a lighting mute switch on the side. All it does is turn off the green LED's that indicate which Remote/s will lead to an alert. The bright blue LED in the center that indicates whether the unit is on stays lit even when the green LEDs are turned off.The remote does not work through glass. I was hopeful that I could mount it in the window near my front door, but that wouldn't work. The unit is water resistant but not waterproof, so mounted outside it will eventually suffer from the exposure. Luckily, I have an overhang that allows for exterior mounting. In my case the unit is set up to alert me if anyone approaches the door. It has done so without fail, with the wireless transmitter successfully reaching my base station through two feet of solid granite and then fifty more feet to the base unit. It's a nice way of knowing if a package has been delivered or if the mail has arrived, as delivery folks don't usually ring the bell.There are some obvious issues if you aim it in such a way that it might see movement from bushes and trees, or if the neighbor's cat walks by. This is a sensitivity issue as well as an aiming issue, so be prepared to realign the unit after you've had a few days of observation as to what works and doesn't work. All necessary mounting hardware is included as are the four AA batteries necessary for the wireless remote.I'm pleased with the overall function but would like to see some improvements:1) the lighting switch on the base unit should turn off the green LEDs and dim the center blue LED.2) the volume knob and related circuitry needs improved specification. Determining the volume setting should not require the alarm to be going off, as it does now. That is, moving the volume knob itself should generate a tone so that you quickly know what the actual alarm volume will be.3) the sensitivity of the remote should be able to be set from the base unit.4) there should be some optional alert tones - something more doorbell-like than a klaxon would be nice.

Reviews.Title: Good for a motion detector
Reviews.Author: J. A. Hansen "kraute und ruben"
Reviews.Content: We set this up last night in our driveway, which is near a busy road, to try out. While it could be nice for someone with a large backyard, or over 30ft long driveway, it kept going off every time a car passed our house, even on the low setting. The other way this could be useful is if you are able to place it with a wall across from it so that spurious background motion doesn't set it off.Set up is extremely easy, if you read the instructions. I didn't at first (I'm a man) and couldn't figure much out on my own, but once I listened to my wife and read the instructions we had it up and running in under five minutes. You can set the sensitivity to either high or low (even low can be high, as noted above), and you can monitor up to three different motion sensors with one parent unit. Overall, it does exactly what it says it will and if you need something to monitor activity on your property this wouldn't be a bad choice for low-level security.

Reviews.Title: I feel safer
Reviews.Author: M. Brown
Reviews.Content: As a mom all I want to do is keep my family safe. With a the Defender Driveway Alert System I feel like I have one more way to do just that. With this system I can be alerted when someone comes into and walks thru my driveway so I know just who is coming close to my home. It gives me and my family a better sense of security. I am going to purchase one for my grandparents and I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: Okay but not great
Reviews.Author: truden
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my mother-in-law so she would feel safer living by herself.  The alarm doesn't go off half the time.  My husband's truck will set it off but my Honda does not.  Other people have knocked on her door that she didn't know had driven up.  Bottom line -- it looks cool.  It is a great concept.  It just does very little good when it doesn't work like it should.

Reviews.Title: Does not always make a sound
Reviews.Author: vicki cady
Reviews.Content: The sound is good but i think i but it to far from the house. Doesn't always catch cars driving through.

Reviews.Title: loses connection
Reviews.Author: Kathy Colon
Reviews.Content: this device just doesnt work for me.  I even placed it less than 100 ft from the receiver and it keeps losing the wireless connection.  unimpressed

Reviews.Title: Good motion detector, a bit expensive
Reviews.Author: J. Luu
Reviews.Content: I've been testing this Driveway Alert System for several days now.  Basically this is a remote motion sensor.  It lets out a series of chirps as long as motion is detected.Things I like:1.  Easy to set up.  Receiver and base paired easily.2.  Alarm is nice and loud, but adjustable to a lower volume.3.  Batteries and all mounting hardware is included4.  One base can handle 3 different zones5.  Motion detector works well.  I've tested it out to 50 feet, and it works great.Things I don't like1.  Both base and detector is larger than necessary.  The base is about the size of an Iphone, 3x the thickness.  The detector is a bit bigger2.  Very plastic, almost flimsy construction.  I have serious doubt that the detector would last very long in a fully exposed environment.3.  On windy days, I get false alarms from moving plants and bushes.4.  Although it can handle 3 zones, I can't find extra detectors anywhere.Overall, I find this to be a useful device in it's role as a motion detector.  Nothing fancy, but does it's job well.  It's a bit on the expensive side and I've yet to be able to locate extra motion sensors.

Reviews.Title: An intruder alert device, but nothing special
Reviews.Author: Paul E. Hartman "pehrtmn"
Reviews.Content: A simple wireless motion detector sensor (one only) which needs 4 AA batteries (which are supplied), after you unscrew the rear portal.  But don't screw it back right away, as you have to 1.  select whether you want the device to detect up to 15 feet, or 30 feet, and 2.  you have to pair it with the alarm device.  The alarm device can be plugged in to a power source.  To make this more functional, you will probably need to purchase additional sensor units.  And also, the alarm that goes off when motion is detected is not all that loud, though, so I didn't feel that this was anything special.It is possible to hook it up to your home alarm system.This might be useful if you are worried about intruders entering your property.  But, again, in order to be practical, you will probably have to purchase additional sensors.

ProductInfo.Features:
30ft detection zone notification the adjustable sensor can detect movement close up and even as far as 30ft away
Weather resistant for outdoor use place the motion sensor outside in your driveway or in a restricted parking lot all year round as the motion sensor is made out of weather resistant material
Go completely wireless with batteries conveniently this wireless driveway alert was designed to conserve battery life in some cases you won't have to replace batteries for over 6 months
Connect to your security system connect the hand held alarm unit to any security system that has a two wire alarm input so that the alarm will go off when motion is detected by your cameras
Adjustable sensitivity select your sensitivity level based on where your motion detector is located
ProductInfo.Name: Defender AL101 Wireless Driveway Alert System with Adjustable Sensitivity
